cover-slide-01.title: Active Career Management
cover-slide-01.author: Bob Fornal
cover-slide-01.bio1:
Entrepreneur
Code-squid provides solid, in-depth frontend training that is supported with real-world code projects. Blessed husband and proud father of two.
cover-slide-01.bio2:
Senior Solutions Developer
Leading EDJE, Inc.
Passionate about learning, testing, mentoring, speaking, and personal growth.

history--slide.title: History
history--slide.textLeft:
My History

  • 25+ Years as a Teacher (Computers)
  • 13+ Years as a Frontend Developer
  • (found) #100Devs Bootcamp
  • 700+ Coffee Chats
Over the years ...
  • "I did nothing to ACTIVELY manage my career."
history--slide.textRight:
My Realization ...

  • Obligation to myself (and my family) to build a strong network.
  • What companies are good companies (by my standards)?
  • Who are the first people I will contact?
  • Am I prepared for the unexpected?
history--slide.notes:
• Throughout my career, I did EVERYTHING WRONG.
  • I started working with bootcamp students and had to figure out how to help them.
  • I had to learn more about myself.
This is a different market.
  • Developers NEED to showcase and advocate for their skills.
  • Many have never had to do this.
  • They do not understand what they NEED to do to stand out ...
  • ... employers chased them before.

career-levels--early-career.title: Career Levels: Early-Career
career-levels--early-career.text1:
Early Career


• Social Media

• Right Job

• Right Company

• Connections
career-levels--early-career.notes:
Social Media:
  • Conferences and Meetups
  • LinkedIn & Twitter
  • Use #100DaysOfCode to work with the algorithm.
Right Job:
  • Goals - define
Right Company:
  • 60 Companies
  • Examine Values
Connections:
  • Fellow students
  • Past co-workers
  • Company peers

Right Job:

Right Company:

build-things--slide.title: Building Things
build-things--slide.textLeft:
Issue

"Stop telling developers to make projects to get a job. I have never had an employer ask me about a project I built!"

Reality

  • This applies more to Junior than Senior.
  • Allows them to show something of significance.
  • Demonstrate proof of skill and impact.
build-things--slide.textRight:
Thoughts

  • Can be used to navigate conversations.
  • Increase confidence.
  • Larger projects is where true learning occurs.
  • Stack the deck in your favor.
build-things--slide.notes:
Projects allow you to ...
  • Show something of significance
  • Show proof of skill and impact
  • Provide talking points
  • Increase confidence

project--slide.title: Project(s)
project--slide.textRight:
Types

  • Group
  • Personal / Passion
  • Exploratory

Considerations

  • Build around what you know
  • What does a good project look like?
  • Broken Links, Bad Spelling, and Grammer
project--slide.notes:
There are a few types of projects.
  • Group
  • Personal / Passion projects allow your care and concern to show through; this should be a solution to a problem you can speak to. Define and work to MVP complete.
  • Exploratory

portfolio--slide.title: Portfolio
portfolio--slide.textLeft:
Sections

  • Hero (with Call To Action)
  • Images as a Dev, at Meetups
  • Projects and Tech Used
  • Resume
  • Contact Information
portfolio--slide.textRight:
Considerations

  • Who are we creating this for?
  • Developers or Recruiter / Hiring Manager?
  • Are resume and links up to date?
portfolio--slide.notes:
• Make sure you have the right focus for your portfolio.
  • Have at least two projects that you have ownership of.
  • Do you need the resume here? Especially, if you are applying for more than one type of position.

resume-ats--slide.title: Resume / ATS
resume-ats--slide.textLeft:
Resume

  • Summary
  • Skills
  • Employment

Considerations

  • Master Resume
  • Simpler is better (no photo, ATS ready)
  • Broken Links, Bad Spelling, and Grammer
  • Regional Differences
  • Cover Letter?
resume-ats--slide.textRight:
Applicant Tracking Systems

"While we are talking about resumes ..."

Considerations

  • Track EVERYTHING
  • Applying Early
  • Opimizing Resume Content Sent
  • "The goal of the recruiter is to hire you; not to reject you." - Francesco Cuilla
resume-ats--slide.notes:
Resume
  • Don't lie.
  • Summary: Why are you the best person for this job?
  • Skills: Just those listed for this job.
  • Focus bullets on what was ROI.
ATS
  • ATS will group by percentage match of resume to posting;
  • then, it will match by time applied - earlier and complete is the best option.
  • Track everything: Application, followups, and thank you (exquisite detail).

linkedin--slide.title: LinkedIn
linkedin--slide.textLeft:
Sections

  • Banner
  • Image
  • Tagline
  • About - Sell yourself
  • Featured - You decide
  • Activity - weekly (minimum)
  • Experience - Industry Standard Terms
  • Skills - Endorsed
  • Recommendations
linkedin--slide.notes:
• Banner needs to say, "I am in technology;" Reduce the cognitive load.
  • Image needs to be clean and bright.
  • Tagline is the first thing a recruiter sees.
  • About - Above The Fold
  • Featured: Resume, Project(s), Portfolio, Articles, Content / Posts (use an image).
  • Activity: The algorithm rewards activity; posts, not re-post.
  • Recommendations - can be considered a "red flag" if not present.

twitter-x--slide.title: x/Twitter
twitter-x--slide.textLeft:
Sections

  • Banner, Image, and Tagline
  • Links
  • Pinned Article

Why?

  • Strong Tech Community
  • Recruiters / Visibility
twitter-x--slide.textRight:
Patterns

  • Follow recruiters
  • Create a recruiter list
  • Retweet good content
  • Find the influencers in your industry
  • People with common interest or passion
  • People in your hometown or current location

Considerations

  • Are links correct?
twitter-x--slide.notes:
Is there value in using x/Twitter?
  • YES; Recruiters find people here all the time
Patterns
  • Recruiters: The list helps you see what they are sharing more easily.
  • RT: People you follow will be grateful.

connections--slide.title: Connections
connections--slide.textLeft:
LinkedIn

  • How to connect?
  • What is your ask?
  • Social Saturday?

x/Twitter

  • Strong Tech Community
  • Recruiters / Visibility
  • Strengthen Connections
connections--slide.textRight:
Considerations

  • Stories - people remember the stories.
  • Active Listening
  • Validate connections in some meaningful way.
  • Use meaningful times to reconnect (Christmas).
connections--slide.notes:
LinkedIn
  • Connecting: Use the activity, become known.
  • What is your ask?
  • Do Social Saturdays have value?
x/Twitter
  • There is a string tech community
  • It increases your visibility; recruiters

interview-types--slide.title: Interview Types
interview-types--slide.textLeft:
• Informal Interview
  • Cultural Fit
  • AI - Resume Overview
  • Technical - Code Challenge
  • Technical - Conversational
  • Technical - Take Home, Code Review
  • Technical - Project on Portfolio
interview-types--slide.textRight:
Things to account for, research, and practice:
  • 30-second elevator pitch.
  • Company Website
  • Postings
  • Interviewer(s)
  • Tech Stack
  • Glassdoor
Plan out questions.
interview-types--slide.notes:
• Informal Interview
  • Cultural Fit
  • AI - Resume Overview
  • Technical - Code Challenge
  • Technical - Conversational
  • Technical - Take Home, Code Review
  • Technical - Project on Portfolio
30-second elevator pitch
  • Remember that it should go beyond the resume and LinkedIn.
Company Website
  • People on LinkedIn, Products, Clients, Feedback, News, Articles, and Values.
Posting
  • What is the job? Re-read any emails. Check calendar invite.
Interviewer(s)
  • LinkedIn, Posts, Articles.
Tech Stack
  • Tools, Libraries, Frameworks (anything on GitHub) - Release Notes and Related Projects.
Glassdoor
  • Interviews, About, People.

job-search--slide.title: Job Search
job-search--slide.text:
2-Hour Job Search

  • Small/Mid-Size Companies
  • Tight Focus on Domain

Thoughts

  • Google Search Pattern
site:icims.com | greenhouse.io | jobvite.io | smartrecruiters.com | workable.com | zoho.com | myworkdayjobs.com "fullstack developer" OR "fullstack engineer" OR "full stack developer" OR "full stack engineer" AND "remote"
job-search--slide.notes:
Job Search
  • Company size - large ar not safe.
  • Domain - build in that stack.
Google Seach Pattern
  • Search within 24 hours, daily.

cold-calling--slide.title: Cold Calling
cold-calling--slide.textLeft:
Cold Emailing

  • Powerful marketing tool.
  • Effective tool for personal branding.
  • Can help you expand your search and potentially uncover new opportunities.

Challenges

  • Getting the recipient to open and read the email.
  • Crafting a message that is both compelling and personalised.
  • Personalisation is key.
  • Value proposition.
  • Make it easy to read.
cold-calling--slide.textRight:
The Right People

  • Identify the ideal customer.
  • Determine their needs and what problems they face.

Mastery

  • Follow up to boost response rates.
  • Reach out through a different communication channel.
  • Balance being pushy with being persistent.
cold-calling--slide.notes:
Cold emailing is a form of communication ...
  • Reaching out to potential employers, professors, customers, or clients
  • Who have not expressed a prior interest in a person.
Challenages
  • Capture their attention.
  • Focus on how you help them, not what YOU want from them.
  • Subject-line: Attention Grabbing (not generic)
  • Clear and concise: introduce yourself and explain why you are reaching out.
  • What can you offer?
